Hennepin County's Real Property Group is hiring an IT Support Intern for our Business Technology Solutions division.

Business Technology Solutions (BTS) is hiring an intern to help us provide IT support to the department's internal customers. This person will provide technical support, create test scripts, run automation scripts, write IT documentation, and problem solve with our team of IT professionals.

We value customer service and are looking for candidates who are well organized and eager to learn new skills. Those hired will receive paid on-the-job experience, skill development training, and networking opportunities within the government of Minnesota’s most populous county.

Location and Hours:
Internships require working 15-20 hours per week. Work hours may be scheduled around students' class schedules but must fall within the regular office hours of Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. - 5 p.m. Work activities will be performed remotely. Duration of internships may last from 6 to 12 months.

Need to have:

  • Current enrollment in good standing as a senior in a bachelor's degree program related to Computer Science or Information Technology as of May 2021.
Nice to have:
  • Knowledge of power shell, SQL, Dot Net or Java
  • Experience and skills using Microsoft Office Suite: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Access, Visio, and/or OneNote
  • Willingness to learn and grow new skills
  • Interest in exploring the public sector as an area for future career growth
  • Ability to:
    • Work effectively with vendors, departments, and county staff in a professional manner, and be courteous and respectful to others
    • Communicate effectively both verbally and in writing
    • Learn software tools and develop new skills necessary to accomplish assignments
    • Recognize and respect cultural differences and provide culturally appropriate services
About the department:
The RPG is made up of the Resident and Real Estate Services Department, Assessor's Office, and Examiner of Titles. RPG is looking to develop the next generation of skilled workers and encourage more people to consider a career in government.

The following are required attachments. If you do not attach the required documents, your application will be considered incomplete.
  • Resume: (including education and relevant course work, skills, languages spoken, internship and volunteer experience, work history, and accomplishments [i.e. honors, awards, etc.])
  • Core Values Essay: This is not a cover letter. In a 1-2 page response (with 1.5 line spacing), describe how you have exhibited each of the 5 Hennepin County Core Values. Please provide specific examples where you've demonstrated these values. We recommend you use the S.T.A.R. method for your answers (i.e. situation, task, action, result). These examples can be from school, work or personal experiences. Do not exceed two pages, as we will not review beyond the second page. Please respond to each value with a separate paragraph. The completed essay must be uploaded under the attachment type "Other" in the online application.
Hennepin County's Core Values
Under each core value, find Hennepin County's definition for what it means to us.
1.) Diversity and Inclusion
Acknowledging and affirming diverse cultures, identities, and experiences to build relationships. Listening to others’ points of view and exercising openness and mindfulness.
2.) Customer Service
Listening, showing empathy, serving through problem solving, meeting needs, and creating a positive customer experience.
3.) Employee Engagement
The ability to work across different groups or areas, taking responsibility for actions, and seeking ways to collaborate with others.
4.) Continuous Improvement
Using creativity and problem solving to approach challenges and support change.
5.) Workforce Development
Taking responsibility for your own development and pursuing learning opportunities.


About Hennepin County:
Hennepin is the largest county government organization in Minnesota. Our employees work every day to improve the health, safety and quality of life for our residents and communities. All of our jobs align to one or more of our overarching goals - that Hennepin County residents are healthy, protected and safe, self-reliant, assured due process, and mobile.

An Intern is an investment in Moog’s future. The intern relationship provides a three-way benefit between the student, university, and Moog. It is an opportunity for the student to incorporate classroom learning into professional, real world situations. The student brings new ideas to Moog on how to tackle projects and challenges, while Moog benefits from fresh perspectives from the brightest students in their respective fields of study. By having the students work on actual programs, we also work towards solving our customers’ most difficult technical challenges.

Moog’s Defense Group is hiring for a part-time Embedded Software Engineering Internship, in Santa Barbara, CA…

As part of the Moog U.S. Internship Program, this position provides strategic and tactical support to senior and mid-level employees.
The student will contribute to routine engineering work requiring the application of standard techniques, procedures, and criteria in carrying out a variety of engineering tasks.
The student will work on discipline-focused projects and tasks to enhance their collegiate learning experience, while providing meaningful contributions to the Moog Engineering Team(s).

Responsibilities
  • Contribute to the preparation and execution of key engineering tasks at Moog
  • Provide technical support to engineers, as needed
  • Provide input on project processes, strategies, and execution
  • Operate as a multidisciplinary member of the team of creative, independent individuals
  • Represent Moog in a manner consistent with its technical and professional reputation

Basic Requirements
  • Enrolled in a Software Engineering or Computer Science Bachelor's or Master's Degree program, at an accredited university
  • GPA of 3.0, or higher
  • Ability to obtain a U.S. security clearance
  • Current 3rd year student or higher, preferred
  • Embedded software capability is a plus!
  • Internship will be onsite, so student must live local to the area.

Students within the Moog U.S. Internship Program are expected to have a professional disposition, with effective communication skills, a strong desire to learn, a positive attitude, and the ability to work in a team environment.

Job ID: 268559


CRH's Americas Materials, a division of CRH, is the leading vertically integrated supplier of aggregates, cement, asphalt, readymixed concrete and paving and construction services in North America. Our operations span North America with 24,100 employees at close to 1,300 locations in 44 US States and 6 Canadian provinces.


Position Overview


The IT Compliance Intern will support compliance by assisting with the development and maintenance of the company compliance and risk management programs. The intern will also assist with testing the effectiveness of the company policies, procedures and overall compliance program.


Key Responsibilities (Essential Duties and Functions)


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.


Assisting CRH AMAT IT Compliance team in the following processes:

  • Support and enhance the IT department’s compliance with the Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX)
  • Test the operating effectiveness of key controls by measuring samples against control attributes
  • Work with IT and business personnel to understand processes and deviations and implement appropriate remediation and risk mitigation
  • Maintain clear and concise documentation in a highly organized manner with conclusions that are supported by the work performed
  • Inform management of audit results
  • Facilitate Control Evidence gathering throughout the year to ensure timely control execution by the control owners;
  • Create/Update Policies and Procedures to meet current Compliance standards; or mature our exisitng processes;
  • Coordinate user access reviews with business financial management semi-annually
  • Compliance Project support as needed throughout the year to meet goals; and support SOX compliance requirements.
  • Coordination of control requests from internal and external auditors
  • Ad hoc reports and projects as needed


Qualifications

Education/Experience


  • Current Junior or Senior in undergraduate degree program in Computer Science, Cyber Security, Audit or Software Development
  • Proficient competency Microsoft Office Suite – heaviest focus on Excel and Powerpoint skills.
  • Familiarity with IT concepts, finance processes, and audit procedures is beneficial, but not required
  • Immediate and ongoing availability
  • 20 hours/week minimum
  • Grade Point Average: 3.0 or above
  • Prior internship experience, a plus


Work Requirements


  • Must be 18 years in age or older.
  • Must pass pre-employment drug screen and criminal background check.
  • Strict adherence to safety requirements and procedures as outlined in the Employee Handbook.
  • Willingness to work independently within in a team environment and assist the team with other duties as required.

Knowledge/Skill Requirements


  • Strong problem solving skills with proven ability to grasp new ideas and skills quickly
  • Ability to consistently drive self to achieve results
  • Understanding of IT security concepts
  • Must possess strong oral / written communication and listening skills
  • Flexible in conforming to shifting priorities and developing ad-hoc analysis
  • Must be extremely detail-oriented with respect to documentation and communication
  • Organized, creative and self directed
  • Willingness to learn and expand one’s abilities


Physical Requirements


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

  • Able to communicate with others by telephone and in person
  • Able to utilize a computer for word processing, email communication, and preparation of documents and presentations.
  • May require sitting for extended periods of time


Work Environment


The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.

  • Usually, normal office working conditions. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet
  • The position may require work outside of normal business hours

The statements included in this job description are not intended to be all-inclusive. They represent typical elements and criteria necessary to successfully perform the job. Other duties may be assigned as required. Requirements for this job are subject to modification by the Company and its designees, and reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


What CRH Offers You


  • A culture that values opportunity for growth, development and internal promotion
  • Highly competitive base pay
  • Comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs
  • Group retirement savings program
  • Health and wellness programs


About CRH Americas


CRH Americas has a long and proud heritage as one of North America’s largest corporations. We are a proud reflection of the hundreds of family businesses, local and regional companies and mid to large sized enterprises that together form the CRH Americas family. CRH Americas operates with a decentralized, diversified structure, letting you work in a small company environment while having the career opportunities of a large enterprise.


CRH Americas is a great place to grow! If you’re up for a rewarding challenge, we invite you to take the first step and apply today! Please complete your online application and profile which will be sent directly to the appropriate Hiring Manager. Thank you for your interest in the CRH Americas family!

Overview:
Omnitracs, LLC is the source for private and for-hire fleets seeking fleet management solutions, including software applications, platforms, and information services. Our intuitive technologies, including solutions for safety and compliance, driver retention, GPS fleet tracking, and fleet maintenance software, can help you solve common fleet problems and achieve your fleet management objectives. With thousands of trucking customers across the Americas, Omnitracs leads the way for fleet management solutions.

As a Data Engineer Intern, you will be responsible for assisting with data management tasks including design, development, and technical administration in an AWS environment. You will also assist with agile leadership. As a Data Engineer Intern, you will have a heavy focus on assisting with the design of solutions to deliver data products. To be successful in this role you will need a basic understanding of data management concepts and how cloud technology can solve data issues. You will also need some knowledge of Agile principles and Scrum.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Building parsers in Python to parse out data into a data warehouse
  • Assist IT Manager with Scrum Master responsibilities
  • Assist IT Engineering Manager with managing IT Development processes
  • Assist with .NET development within a Sprint
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Rising Junior or Senior pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or other related majors.
  • Basic knowledge of Python, SQL, and AWS
  • Basic experience with ETL tools
OUR PROGRAM:
  • Personal and professional development
  • 1:1 Mentorship Opportunities
  • Executive Speaker Series
  • Fun and engaging social events
  • Rated the “Standout Virtual Internship Program of 2020” by WayUp

June 2021 – August 2021 (9 weeks-Remote)

POSITION SUMMARY
The IT Intern will support VIDA IT department staff with day-to-day information technology (IT) operations, which may include providing hardware and software support, installation setups, backups/restores and other system maintenance. The intern will also be responsible for assisting with documentation, implementing solutions, as well as tracking hardware and software inventory.

Along with day to day responsibilities, there will be special projects and the opportunity to use automation and programming skills.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

· Provide timely support for end users

· Assist in troubleshooting issues

· Help with upgrading network equipment

· Assist in organizing and maintaining IT resources

· Assist in the daily operations of the IT department

· Monitor activities of assigned IT areas to ensure compliance with internal policies and procedures

· Test system backups and restores

· Gain a working knowledge of IT systems and security

· Perform security walkthroughs and report findings

· Support the information security audits and testing

· Support internal staff in researching policies, procedures, and best practices

· Assist with maintenance and testing of VIDA’s Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery plans

· Help administer and maintain Linux/Windows servers, Windows computers, storage and network infrastructure, Active Directory, Group Policy, DNS, systems backups

Employees who do not possess the requirements for a job at the time of hire will not be considered for the position. Must

  • Have experience with Windows system administration and have basic knowledge of Linux systems
  • Capable of working effectively independently and in a team environment
  • Strong Communication skills for both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Must be self-motivated, goal and detail oriented
  • Monitoring and reporting security incidents
  • Experience in a help desk or technician like position

Desired

  • Have experience with configuring and maintaining Active Directory, Group Policies Objects, DNS

and other MS server roles, Unix/Windows, SaaS, IaaS, networking devices, database, application servers, virtualization, basic networking configuration

  • Experience with cloud storage
  • Experience with VPN services
  • Experience with HIPAA and other compliance standards.

Education and Credential Requirements

College student pursuing a bachelor’s or master’s degree in an Information Technology related field with a minimum 3.5 GPA

Language Requirements

English is the main language at VIDA.

CROSS TRAINING/BACKUP REQUIREMENTS

SCHEDULE EXPECTATIONS

VIDA’s normal hours of operation are from Monday through Friday, from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, however; this position may occasionally require work performed on nights and/or weekends.

Vocera delivers the leading platform for clinical communication and workflow. Our mission is to simplify and improve the lives of healthcare professionals, patients, and families while enabling hospitals to enhance quality of care and operational efficiency and humanize the healthcare experience. Hospitals and health systems around the world have selected our solutions to enable care teams to communicate and collaborate using smartphones or our hands-free, wearable Vocera Smartbadge and Vocera Badge. They can create a richer, more human connection for patients and their loved ones before, during, and after care using Vocera Ease applications. Our platform is interoperable with most clinical and operational systems used in hospitals. In addition to healthcare, Vocera solutions are found in aged care facilities, veterinary hospitals, luxury hotels, retail stores, schools, power facilities, libraries, and more. Vocera is headquartered in San Jose, California, with offices in Indiana, Orlando, Canada, India, United Arab Emirates, Australia, and the United Kingdom. Learn more at www.vocera.com and follow @VoceraComm and @VoceraEase on Twitter.

Position Description: The Platform Engineering Internship is an opportunity to grow your software development and engineering skills. You will be a member of our platform engineering team whose responsibility it is to build maintain the infrastructure of the overall platform as well as continued feature and stability enhancements of our messaging server. Our internship is designed for individuals who are currently enrolled at an accredited college/university and who will be continuing their studies in the fall.

Responsibilities

  • Java and some Ruby application development on platform and messaging server solution
  • Full lifecycle engineering including analysis, design, development, and testing
  • Research bugs and customer issues and determine appropriate resolutions
  • Participate in grooming sessions, bug scrubs, stand-ups, and sprint planning.
  • You will have the opportunity to participate and learn about working in an agile team environment

Competencies

  • Strong analysis and troubleshooting skills.
  • Well organized with strong attention to detail; proactively ensures work is accurate and error-free
  • Self-motivated and aptitude to learn quickly
  • Positive attitude and work ethic
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; strong sense of professionalism

Requirements

  • Candidates should be seeking a bachelor’s or advanced degree in Computer Science or a related field.
  • Working knowledge of Java programming language and understanding of multithreading concepts.
  • Experience with Ruby and/or bash scripting a plus but not required.
  • Able to work independently at times and dedicate a minimum of 20 hours/week
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without restriction
  • Must be willing to submit to a background investigation, including verification of your employment and criminal history
  • Must be 18 years of age or older

Belief in Diversity

Vocera Communications is an Affirmative Action Employer committed to workforce diversity. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, or genetic information.

position: Software Engineering Intern - ML Accelerator/GPU Programming
description:
Company Overview

Come join a higher calling and find a deeper purpose!

As a multi-national Artificial Intelligence Technology Company, we are at the epicenter of the Autonomous Vehicle Universe. Our breakthroughs are leading the industry in autonomous trucking.

While inventing the framework of Autonomous Driving, our current fleet of autonomous trucks are helping communities receive much-needed supplies and medical equipment around the clock. Our people are some of the most talented engineers and contributors who are leaving behind a historic legacy.

TuSimple was founded half a decade ago with the goal of bringing the top minds in the world together to achieve the dream of a driverless truck solution. With a foundation in computer vision, algorithms, mapping, and Artificial Intelligence, TuSimple is working to create the first global commercially viable Autonomous Freight Network.

Opportunity Overview:

  • Accelerating existing algorithms using CUDA and GPU.
  • Minimizing hardware resource usage, e.g. GPU memory footprint, through proper resource management.
  • Building GPU-accelerated Machine Learning Library.

Role Responsibilities:

  • Test, bench, and build tools for benchmarking ML algorithms on the hardware accelerator.
  • Design and develop new GPU operators with high-quality codes.
  • Analyze the software and identify potential performance bottlenecks.

Experience & Skills Required:

  • MS in Computer Science or other related fields in top schools
  • Solid understanding of GPU/CUDA
  • Strong programming skills

Preferred Skills and Experience:

  • Development experiences in Machine Learning Libraries, such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, TVM, MXNet
  • Experience in arm-based embedded systems/Nvidia Drive products
  • Strong System Skills (Operating System, Parallel Computing, Computer Architecture)

Perks

  • Work with world class AI Engineers
  • Shape the landscape of autonomous driving
  • Competitive salary
  • Daily breakfast, lunch, and dinner

General Summary:

This internship opportunity will provide the applicant entry-level IP network experience with progressive responsibility and experience. As an Intern Position the successful applicant will be able to gain experience and build their resume by further developing and learning IT skills.

Applicant must be able to work independently or in a group environment, be self-motivated and not afraid to learn. This position will work under the direct supervision of the IP Network Administrator

Essential Job Functions:

  • Hands on work assisting the IP Network Technicians in planning, installing, configuring, maintaining, supporting, and optimizing Pioneer's Corporate and Service Provider networks.
  • Commits to maintaining a work environment that encourages positive employee relationships within the division and other departments to establish a climate of openness and trust.
  • Exemplifies dependability standards through adherence to timelines and schedules. Commits to performing job tasks in a manner that ensures a safe work environment.
  • Willingly and cooperatively performs other related duties as assigned by management.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • College student entering Junior or Senior year majoring in Networking, Computer Science, Electrical/Computer Engineering, Information Technology or a similar field.
  • Must possess and maintain a good driving record and a valid driver license.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Knowledge of basic Ethernet networking.
  • Follow configuration and change management processes.
  • Passionate about networking, information technology or computer science.
  • Skill in analytical and problem-solving skills with ability to troubleshoot technical problems.
  • Ability to multi-task, self-start, work in a dynamic team environment and work independently.
  • Willing to tackle new challenges and develop new skills.
  • Ability to communicate with customers, co-workers and various business contacts in a professional and courteous manner.
  • Ability to meet deadlines and achieve optimum results.
  • Ability to effectively function as a team player and to project a positive attitude.
  • Ability to maintain strict confidentiality guidelines in accordance with company policy.
  • Ability to demonstrate dependability through good attendance and adherence to timelines and schedules.

Physical Requirements:

  • Sitting or standing for extended periods, walking, finger dexterity, feeling, repetitive motions, talking, hearing and visual acuity including close vision.
  • May be required occasionally to stoop, kneel or bend and lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Must be able to climb, stand on a ladder, and be in confined spaces for extended periods.
  • Ability to drive for extended periods.
  • Must be able to distinguish colors.

EWI is a world leader in developing and deploying new technologies that enable companies to bridge the gap between R&D and manufacturing implementation. EWI Associates are passionate about identifying out-of-the-box options that provide a long-term competitive advantage for our clients. Our clients tell us we are a valuable extension and complement to their innovation, engineering and manufacturing teams. If you enjoy working with customers and solving challenging, technical problems, EWI is the place for you.


EWI provides a rich learning environment for undergraduate and graduate students seeking opportunity for practical application of metallurgical, welding, mechanical, materials science, industrial engineering and allied fields. Engineer Interns will assist Engineers and Technicians in project work and perform tasks which allow EWI to operate more efficiently as a whole. During the program interns will transition from a technical labor-based position to that of a functioning engineer, gaining exposure to different industries and technologies along the way.


Internship opportunities vary with business needs. During the summer term, interns are expected to work 40 hours per week. If the opportunity is available, interns may be able to work in the fall and spring semesters for a defined number of hours per week in coordination with the student’s curriculum.

**There are five (5) total internship positions available focusing on the following technologies:

  • Resistance & Solid-State Welding & Materials
  • Polymers
  • Metal Forming
  • Laser Processing
  • Arc Welding & DED Processes


KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES:

  • Strong interpersonal communication skills and ability to effectively present to a group
  • Proven adaptability and flexibility as a part of team
  • Proven success in a team-oriented environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication abilities
  • Solutions-oriented mindset
  • Desire to work in hands-on lab environment and research environment
  • Seeking to learn from leading minds in innovation
  • Demonstrated initiative to exceed customer expectations
  • Proficient in MS Office

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

  • Laboratory/light production floor with ventilation, climate-control system, moderate lighting, and moderate noise level;
  • Use finger dexterity to type, adjust, move, handle, perform, operate, install, attach, remove, apply, grasp, manipulate, and measure;
  • Frequently move, transport, rotate, reach, pull, twist, adjust position, push, stoop, bend, and crouch; and
  • Lift ten to 40 pounds on a frequent basis and 40 to 80 pounds occasionally


ENGINEERING CURRICULUM REQUIREMENTS:

  • Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate program in engineering at an accredited university
  • Engineering disciplines preferred:
    • Welding
    • Materials Science
    • Mechanical
    • Polymers
    • Chemical
    • Electrical
    • Industrial
    • Software
    • Computer Science
    • Other relevant areas of study

About the Company

Lincoln Financial Group, a Fortune 250 company with over 10,000 employees, provides advice and solutions that help empower Americans to take charge of their financial lives with confidence. Our core business areas — Life Insurance, Annuities, Retirement Plan Services and Group Protection — focus on supporting, preserving and enhancing over 17 million customer’s lifestyles and retirement outcomes.

Headquartered in Radnor, Pennsylvania, Lincoln Financial Group is the marketing name for Lincoln National Corporation (NYSE: LNC) and its affiliates. The company had $238 billion in assets under management as of December 31, 2018.

Ranked one of the Best Large Employers in America by Forbes magazine, Lincoln Financial Group makes a serious investment in our employees’ futures through a broad range of wealth accumulation and protection plans, health and wellness programs, and career development resources designed to help each individual reach their personal and professional goals.

General Purpose of Job

Our actuarial interns are a key part of our organization because they perform meaningful work in an environment that supports their learning within various business units of the company.
Long Description

During the 11-week internship over the summer, our actuarial interns learn about our products while working in a variety of disciplines including financial reporting and planning, valuation, pricing and product development, and asset/liability management across lines of business including life insurance, annuities, group protection, and retirement services.
We offer actuarial internship positions in six locations:
Atlanta, GA Boston, MA Dover, NH
Fort Wayne, IN Hartford, CT Greensboro, NC Omaha, NE Radnor, PA

In addition, interns participate in a series with speakers from business leaders across the organization, as well as attend lunch and learn sessions focused on networking, execution, and agility in the workplace. Furthermore,
the interns enjoy a variety of social events with other interns and Actuarial Development Program participants. We offer both competitive pay and housing support.

Responsibilities:
  • Compile, categorize and audit data
  • Document and verify factors used in computations and actuarial models Run models and analyze output for consistency and reasonableness
  • Gain knowledge about company operations, systems, and actuarial methodologies Depending on area, develop rate filings, in-force files, and experience study results Depending on area, assist in the determination of premiums, benefits, and pricing levels
Requirements:
  • One or more SOA exams preferred GPA of 3.0 or higher
  • Pursuing undergraduate degree in Actuarial Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative major is required.
  • Demonstrated leadership experience
  • Strong communication and problem solving skills
  • Ability to quickly learn and apply new skills and information Strong curiosity and creativity
  • Authorization to work in the U.S. without employer sponsorship
Other Skills and Abilities
  • Ability to perform under stress in cases of emergency, critical or hazardous situations.
  • Ability to work with others in a team environment.
  • Demonstrated solid relationship management skills with internal clients (e.g. management, peers and colleagues).
  • Demonstrates excellent organizational skills with the ability to prioritize workload and multi-task while maintaining strict attention to detail.
  • Demonstrates strong interpersonal skills with a collaborative style.
  • Demonstrates the ability to use sound judgment and discretion regarding confidential information.
  • Finds common ground and can gain collaboration among management, colleagues and peers.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
  • Successfully completes regulatory and job training requirements.
Education
  • Other: - Minimum Required in Undergraduate degree in Actuarial Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative major.
Experience
  • 0 - 1+ Years of experience in actuarial science that directly aligns with the specific responsibilities for this position (Required )
  • 1 SOA exam preferred

The Lubrizol Corporation, a Berkshire Hathaway company, is a market-driven global company serving customers in more than 100 countries. We own and operate manufacturing facilities in 17 countries, as well as sales and technical offices around the world. Through our global sales and manufacturing networks, we are able to deliver the products and services our customers need, where and when they need them.

At Lubrizol, our mission is straightforward: We improve lives as an essential partner in our customers’ success, delivering efficiency, reliability or wellness to their end users. Read the cover story in Smart Business Magazine to learn how Lubrizol plans to advance its growth.

Audit & Risk Management Internship


Job Description

During your Summer internship, you will work closely with experienced professionals as an active member of a diverse and innovative team to help us achieve our mission of helping the world Move Cleaner, Create Smarter and Live Better. This opportunity will provide you with real-world experience to bring to your future full-time career. Students will strive to make our environment more secure by assisting in the execution of audits and risk management assessments. This will include exposure to many different processes and teams across the organization providing a variety of experiences. You will have the opportunity to work with several teams such as Information Security and Compliance team, Internal Audit, and potentially external auditors to execute the work and remediate any potential issues. Close collaboration with individuals across the global Information Solutions department will be required to gather evidence to ensure our solutions are designed and operating effectively.


Qualifications

  • Active student pursuing an undergraduate degree in Accounting, Information Technology, or other business or technology related fields.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent computer skills, including Microsoft Office and SharePoint.
  • Ability to work under pressure and under fluctuating deadlines.
  • Ability to interact with a variety of personnel easily and professionally.
  • Students with a 3.0 or greater GPA will be given priority consideration.
  • Must be authorized to work in the United States without requiring work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future.

Benefits

  • Join 8-10 other co-op and intern students for our Summer rotation.
  • Students receive a variety of opportunities in our Information Solutions department.
  • Work alongside experienced professionals to help achieve our missions of helping the world Move Cleaner, Create Smarter and Live Better.
  • Students explore a variety of opportunities in the main areas of our department: Application Services, Business Processes, and Infrastructure.
  • Competitive hourly wage with tenure-based raises.
  • Paid holidays within your work period.
  • Semesterly philanthropy, networking, and professional development events.

With multiple facilities in and around Cleveland, Ohio, Lubrizol is located in one of the largest economic regions in the United States. For the last seven years Lubrizol has been named one of the top workplaces in Northeast Ohio, and in 2016 was judged as the number one workplace by Northeast Ohio’s annual Top Workplaces survey. Buzzing with business, culture, knowledge and entertainment, Northeast Ohio is a vibrant place for people of all ages and walks of life to live, learn, work and play. This region offers a little bit of everything for everyone - ethnically-diverse communities, affordable housing, award-winning schools and universities, world-class healthcare, indoor waterparks and zoos, ski resorts, museums, halls of fame, one of the longest water-fronts in the country, and the most concentrated square mile of art, cultural, education and health institutions in the nation. From making your heart race at Cedar Point, to attending a professional sporting event or biking or hiking through over the 100,000 acres of state parks, to catching a Broadway show at Playhouse Square - the second largest performing arts center in the country, you can make it happen right here in Cleveland, Ohio.


Lubrizol is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, national origin, citizenship, age, religion, marital status, military service, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity, or any other characteristic or trait protected by federal, state, or local law.

Please note that this phone line and email address are not to be used for checking on the status of an already submitted application and not to be used by third party recruiters.

  • Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op
  • Curiosity and desire to deliver business value and present data-driven insights to business audiences

As an Experian Intern, you will work on challenging assignments with a clear understanding of your contribution to our organization. The Decision Analytics team is looking for a Software Development Intern to join their team. This internship will be 40 hours per week for 10 weeks with a start date in June 2021. The DA team helps clients turn challenging situations into confident decisions through analytics, decisioning and fraud and identity. The intern will be part of a team that assists with go-to-market strategies for our latest products.

What you would be doing

You will work within the Product Development or DevOps teams of the North America Decision Analytics business unit, which focuses on the development and delivery of Fraud prevention and Credit decisioning solutions for the financial market. You will contribute to one or several projects in the areas of product development or operational support, for example:

  • Prototyping and experimenting with new technologies and platforms in support of future product developments.
  • Assisting with automated application testing
  • Assisting with DevOps related tasks
  • Increasing code quality by implementing clean code practices across our code base
  • You’ll use tools such as Eclipse, Junit, Selenium, Jenkins, OpenShift, Kubernetes, Docker and SonarQube among many others.

What your background looks like

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field
  • Proficient in Java
  • Proven ability to work independently and make good decisions with minimal direction
  • High digital proficiency and written presentation skills

Join the leader in entertainment innovation and help us design the future. At Dolby, science meets art, and high tech means more than computer code. As a member of the Dolby team, you’ll see and hear the results of your work everywhere, from movie theaters to smartphones. We continue to revolutionize how people create, deliver, and enjoy entertainment worldwide. To do that, we need the absolute best talent. We’re big enough to give you all the resources you need and small enough so you can make a real difference and earn recognition for your work. We offer a collegial culture, challenging projects, and excellent compensation and benefits.

The world is changing as we know it. It is more important than ever that communications and entertainment services are available to users to connect wherever they may be. Here at Dolby, our mission is to enable experiences that transcend expectations and reach the spectacular. We need your creative solutions and diverse thought. The Dolby U internship program offers impactful, project-based work experience in a collaborative, creative environment where you work side by side with industry leaders.


Amplify your insatiable curiosity by implementing real-world solutions that revolutionize how people communicate and how entertainment is created, delivered, and enjoyed worldwide. For any student seeking to gain invaluable expertise through meaningful, personal contributions, we invite you to join us in continuing to design a future where technology meets entertainment!



SUMMARY


We have an environment of state-of-the-art R&D with a culture – big enough to give you all the resources you need, and small enough so you can make a real difference. You will be working on the development, implementation, test engineering, and quality assurance of innovative imaging/video processing algorithms, Dolby Vision, and related technologies.


We are looking for self-motivated, talented individuals interested in applying their theoretical and practical expertise in computational data-driven development as well as develop prototypes to shape the future of entertainment.


You will work as part of the Science team to research and ideate algorithms and technologies for our Dolby.io cloud API infrastructure. Dolby.io is our new, high-visibility self-service audio/video processing APIs that will bring Dolby’s innovations and unique expertise to new and existing customers. RESPONSIBILITIES

You will work closely with scientists and engineers, and you will be involved in the research and the implementation of innovative technologies to our Cloud infrastructure.


This is a junior scientist role, which requires knowledge of machine learning and deep learning, statistics, data analytics, fast prototyping skills, experience with Python and other programming languages. You will research and design new algorithms for Speech, Music and Video processing and extraction of analytics. You will deliver quality work against technical challenges in a dynamic environment while following strong software design and process principles to meet our internal demands.

  • Proficient in application development. Cross-platform development experience. Experienced C/C++, Swift, Objective-C and/or Java. Experience with Apple OSes, Linux and/or Windows.

  • Rapid prototyping.

  • Quick and dynamic learner.

  • Strong interest in learning and researching innovative technologies.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

  • Experience working in teams and a team-oriented work ethic.

  • Previous experience working in Speech Analysis is preferred.


ELIGIBILITY

  • Must be available to work full-time Monday – Friday for 12 months

Job Summary

The Summer Intern program at CooperSurgical provides university students with the opportunity to participate in meaningful projects that contribute to the overall business unit objectives. In addition to the assigned projects, Interns are given the opportunity to participate in activities that encourage networking with peers, managers, and employees.

Essential Functions

  • Perform first-level analysis, diagnosis, and resolution of desktop, printer, or scanner problems for end users in office and/or distribution center environment. Gathers preliminary information and performs initial troubleshooting to resolve or escalate support requests as needed.
  • Perform password resets and account unlocks using Active Directory and Okta.
  • Applying, installing, diagnosing, repairing, maintaining, and upgrading PC and Mac hardware, thin clients, and peripheral equipment to ensure optimal workstation performance.

  • Support offshore team by handling call overflow on ACD or issues needing escalation.
  • Monitor and coordinate onboarding/offboarding calendar to ensure timely actioning of all associated tasks by applicable team members.
  • Create and maintain end-user documentation/knowledgebase for hardware and software in service catalog.
  • Maintain an inventory of IT equipment at the site.
  • Facilitate equipment returns from terminated users or due to device replacements.
  • Liaise with third-party support and equipment vendors for inventory purchasing and hardware repairs.
  • Keep applicable process and SOP documentation up to date.
  • Identify and suggest areas for process improvement.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.

Scope

  • This position provides IT support to both on-site and remote employees around the world to resolve requests submitted via phone, email, or ticketing system.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Foundational technical knowledge of PC and Mac and desktop hardware, including printers, scanners and peripheral devices
  • Foundational technical knowledge of PC operating systems and client configuration in domain environment.
  • Hands-on hardware troubleshooting experience.
  • Ability to read and understand technical manuals, procedural documentation, and OEM guides.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills in English is required to communicate with the global team.
  • Ability to present ideas in user-friendly language.
  • Analytical and problem-solving abilities, with keen attention to detail.
  • Self-motivated and directed, with the ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
  • Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
  • Ability to work independently
  • Strong customer-service orientation.
  • Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
  • Intermediate skill in the use of Excel, Word and PowerPoint. Advanced preferred.
  • Well organized with attention to detail and ability to carry out tasks independently.
  • Excellent project management, organizational and follow-through skill set
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Professional demeanor

Experience

  • Not required, but prior Internship experience is a plus.

Education

  • Current university student, majoring in Computer Science or related field of study, entering their Junior or Senior year.
  • Completed course work in computing fundamentals.

Looking for a place to kickstart your career? Join one of the fastest growing FinTech companies in Northeast Ohio and think about applying for a rewarding Summer Internship with us! CardinalCommerce, a Visa solution, works to make online shopping as safe and easy as possible. We put authentication first because we believe digital commerce should be safe, rewarding and engaging for everyone involved in the process.

Here at Cardinal, our experienced and passionate employees want to share their wisdom with you! Starting with a two-week training program, our interns participate in an Intern Immersion experience where they learn more about Cardinal's services, hear from our Senior Leadership team and network with Cardinal employees throughout all of our different departments. With the support from their mentors, Cardinal interns are tasked with responsibilities that contribute to our bottom line and are given an environment to learn and grow. Summer interns at Cardinal walk away with real-world work experience and a network of peers and mentors to support their career development.

The Technical Services team within Customer Services uses our programming-related skills to assist our clients and those who directly support our clients through integration and beyond. This internship is an opportunity to participate in a group that prizes practical application of technical know-how in cooperation with non-technical peers to immediately affect the quality of client relationships.

What You'll Do:

We're looking to hire full-time undergrad and graduate students to join our team in the summer of 2021. As a Cloud Engineering intern, you will have the opportunity to contribute to the success of the company through the development of custom tooling, CI/CD workflows, building and managing AWS infrastructure (as Code) and enabling our application developers. . All internswork side-by-side with our engineers on production-level code. Additionally, all interns are paired with a mentor.

You’ll be expected to have a deep understanding of CS fundamentals, and you will gain a much deeper understanding of the best engineering practices for a host of applications. You’ll also have a chance to:

  • Work on unique technical problems in a rare and emerging field
  • Work in small teams to quickly design and build solutions to novel problems
  • Work with modern technologies like Python for high-performance computing, git, Docker, Amazon Web Services (AWS), CI/CD and more

Internship Requirements

  • Experience solving problems with code
  • Currently pursuing a degree in computer science or a related field with a graduation date of Fall 2021, Spring 2022, Fall 2022
  • Experience with one or more Object Oriented or scripting languages
  • Enthusiasm and basic knowledge of Cloud Engineering and Services (specifically AWS Lambda, Fargate/ECS, Step Functions, Infrastructure as Code and Docker Containers)
  • Enthusiasm to learn and contribute to our team in a meaningful way
  • Strong motivation and the ability to collaborate with others

What to Expect

New challenges almost every day! Be ready to take your computer science paradigms and apply them in new ways. We work and build in the Cloud (specifically AWS) where services and technologies are constantly evolving. You’ll be working on projects that range from build/deploy tooling to larger scale architecture implementations. You’ll be exposed to AWS services and architecture that span containers, machine learning, data processing and pipelining, and more. Prepare to work alongside driven team-first high-performing individuals.

About the Cloud Engineering Team @ Narrative Science

The Cloud Engineering team at Narrative Science specializes in delivering high-value cloud-based solutions to product and application development teams. Specifically, we are responsible for building and innovating on continuous delivery pipelines, build and deploy tooling, and seamlessly integrating cloud architecture into our applications. Our primary customers are other developers and we work to provide them a frictionless cloud-first development experience.

Culture @Narrative Science

Narrative Science believes that data storytelling can empower everyone to understand and take action from their data. Our mission is to build software that leverages artificial intelligence to automatically turn data into easy-to-understand reports, transforms statistics into stories, and converts numbers into knowledge.

Our core virtues (mission-driven, impactful, team first, innovative) are ingrained in everything we do, from how we develop our technology to how we interact with customers to how we hire people. Since 2020, we have embraced a remote-first approach and our team has the option to work from home or safely from our Chicago office. This flexibility will remain after COVID.

At Narrative Science, we embrace the diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of our future employees, colleagues, customers, partners, and other stakeholders. We provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, marital status, citizenship, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Join a technology company dedicated to improving lives through innovative technology solutions. Today, Raven is focused on solving these Great Challenges:

  • Feeding a growing population by improving agricultural efficiency around the world
  • Protecting our natural resources
  • Saving and improving lives through advanced situational awareness
  • Connecting the world

Raven is organized into three business units that sell our advanced products and solutions within their niche markets. Our Corporate Services team supports the daily operations and business activities of all three.

Build your career at a technology-driven company dedicated to Solving Great Challenges. Our highly accomplished Software Development team is motivated, innovative—and knows how to have fun.
At Raven, our team members have the opportunity to succeed in a highly challenging and rewarding work environment. Working alongside other Software Development team members, an IT Software Developer Intern will need to have a familiarity of different programming languages and databases. Our team builds software applications focusing on efficient manufacturing, forecasting, modeling, integrating with various software, and business intelligence applications.
Our company engineers ground-breaking technologies in the areas of communications, safety, feeding the world, and environmental preservation. These diverse business segments offer a unique environment, and our IT team consistently expand their skillsets while working with a wide variety of technologies and solutions. This environment will allow you to grow the skills necessary to continue to advance your career and will give you plenty of opportunities to do so! In addition to the growth opportunities within the Development team, such as Senior, Staff and Principal Positions - there are also opportunities for advancement across the organization. Raven is committed to a culture of employee development—where our team members are taking care of themselves in body, mind, and spirit. Take a break on our rooftop patio, challenge your teammates to a ping pong match, or head over to the Raven Fitness Center. Our corporate headquarters, located in vibrant Downtown Sioux Falls, is also adjacent to the city’s bike trails and River Greenway.
Interested? Apply to join our team, where you can exercise your technical skills, contribute to an innovative, fast-paced environment, and develop solutions to great challenges.

  • Good work ethic and solid trouble shooting skills

Unity is looking for a SDK Engineer Intern on the Ads SDK team. This team is passionate about building the next generation of Unity's monetization suite. As the leading development platform for online and mobile games, Unity is helping take developer's creations further and faster than ever before. Unity Monetization enables developers to build a business through advertising, in-app purchases and analytics. Our fast growing business requires us to set up a dedicated team to support a growing number of advertising creatives and formats with an ever-growing number of partners.

In this role, an interest in mobile-based frontend development is key, coupled with iOS or Android development experience. Our formats run in thousands of different handsets used by over a billion people around the world each month, so delivering flawless, high-performance frontend code is one of the key criteria for the team.

Responsibilities

  • Improve our mobile ad serving web views using HTML, CSS, Typescript
  • Contribute to our mobile SDKs for Android and iOS that integrate into our games
  • Contribute to how our ad product works with the Unity Editor
  • Work across the engineering organization to ensure high-quality continuous delivery with unit and integration tests
  • Write high quality code that supports existing and future functionality of the product

Requirements

  • Pursuing a Bachelor's degree or graduate degree in Computer Science
  • Experience in working with large code bases and interfacing with complex systems (academic or professional)
  • Experience in API design and developing clean and maintainable code (academic or professional)

Bonus Points

  • Experience in iOS/Android developer
  • Experience in Unity tools and/or gaming
  • Familiarity with different AdTech format standards (MRAID, VAST, etc.)
  • Development experience in Typescript, Node and related tools

About Unity Technologies

Unity is the world's leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity's platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

The company's 1,400+ person research and development team keeps Unity at the forefront of development by working alongside partners to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Apps developed by Unity creators were downloaded more than three billion times per month in 2019 on more than two billion unique devices. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

Discover careers that change the world and further advancements in defense, technology, and engineering today at Northrop Grumman. Use your experience to grow your career and support our global customers with the technology, systems, and solutions they need to enable their missions on the front lines and secure our world every day. With Northrop Grumman, you’ll discover a culture built on diversity, respect, and above all teamwork. Together with our group of experts across the technical spectrum, you’ll discover opportunities to make a difference in our world and start solving some of the world’s most critical problems in the most innovative ways.

Northrop Grumman is seeking an Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning Engineering Intern to join the Defense Systems Intern Program. This position will be located in Beavercreek, OH.

The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman’s Combat Systems & Mission Readiness Division, Mission Readiness & Protective Systems Business Unit, Strategic C2 Operating Unit.

As an intern, you’ll participate in a summer internship program to develop competencies in a variety of Software engineering specializations that may include: -Development in one or more of the following languages: Java, C++, C#, Python. -Web development frameworks such Angular. -Utilize database technologies such as Oracle and NoSQL databases. -Develop low level software to control various devices and machines. -Design/develop algorithms and software in support of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning projects.

Basic Qualifications

A candidate, regardless of age and hiring source, must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:

  • Be enrolled full-time and pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree from an accredited college/university AND graduating after August 2021
  • Be majoring in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or another related technical field
  • Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0/4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)
  • Be available to work full-time (40 hours per week) for at least 10 weeks during summer 2021
  • Be able to obtain and maintain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)

Preferred Qualifications:

-3.7 cumulative GPA or higher -Previous internship/co-op experience and/or specializing in software engineering. -Concentration and/or prior expience in artificial intelligence & machine learning. -Previous experiences in leadership & teamwork capabilities, interpersonal communication skills, and activities professional/community/extracurricular)



Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

Responsibilities:

Apply modern Data Analysis and AI technologies and development tools to search, categorize, filter, and profile tens of thousands of operations that are extensively traced through a heavily multi-threaded multi-user server system. Goal is to associate and characterize these numerous flows then isolate areas of concern to visualize desired specifics within the noise. Multiple teams of embedded SW, applications SW, and signal processing engineers use this information to visualize and optimize the design.


Requirements:

  • Working towards Bachelors in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent mix of education and experience.
  • AI and Data Analysis course work or studies.
  • Hands-on experience with development tools to include Python, C/C++, web/visualization/graphing platforms and languages.
  • Desire to learn complex heavily multi-threaded SW systems.
  • Ability to collaborate and communicate effectively in small team.

About Litepoint

LitePoint creates wireless test solutions and services for the world’s most innovative wireless device makers, helping them to ensure their products perform for today’s demanding consumers. A leading innovator in wireless testing, LitePoint products come out of the box ready to test the most widely used wireless chipsets in the world. LitePoint works with the leading makers of smartphones, tablets, PCs, wireless access points and chipsets. LitePoint is also at the forefront of testing the burgeoning world of connected devices…the Internet of Things. Headquartered in Silicon Valley, California and with offices around the world. LitePoint is a wholly owned subsidiary of Teradyne (NYSE: TER), a leading supplier of automation equipment for test and industrial applications. In 2019, the combined corporation had revenue of $2.3 billion and employs approximately 5,500 people worldwide.

Great People Power Great Internships

You want to know how things work. And once you figure that out, you want to make them work differently. Connecting humans and technology through tinkering, engineering, and creating is just one of your many passions. You have rad ideas that you’re not afraid to share, as well as the ability to make them come to life.

What You’ve Got Under Your Belt:

  • You’re a recent college graduate, or you’re currently studying Technology, Information Systems, Computer Science, or something similar.
  • You possess development skills in HTML, .NET, PHP, SQL, Python, and more.
  • You’re familiar with Content Management Systems such as Umbraco, Wordpress, Drupal, or CraftCMS.
  • You share a desire to manipulate data from APIs in order to create new utilities.
  • You have a base knowledge and interest in physical computing and microcontrollers.
  • You’ve got a strong ability to solve problems creatively and independently.
  • Your organizational and communication skills are next level.
  • Your attitude is on point.

SharePoint Developer Intern


About the Position

The SharePoint Developer Intern is responsible for providing front-end support for the application development projects within the SharePoint stack. This role will work in accordance with LGFCU-MIS software development lifecycle to design and develop both custom and OOTB solutions to meet the needs of our internal customers. This position works with all organizational units to address information gaps, identify areas for improvement and uncover other strategic opportunities within the system such as (but not limited to) business process automation. Additional responsibilities include performing system analysis, end-user training and troubleshooting application or production issues.


Normal Day-to-Day Work

  • Provide application development and technical support for all cross-tenant, site collections within the SharePoint/Office 365 Platform.
  • Develop and maintain SharePoint systems using Microsoft Development tools.
  • Provide front-end administration and development in SharePoint 2013/16/SharePoint Online platform to include document management automated workflow, collaboration, messaging and content management.
  • Develop custom lists, views, libraries and integrate enterprise content within the platform to include content formatting and workflows to meet internal requirements.
  • Work with senior team members to prepare functional specifications from which solutions are to be designed, built and tested.
  • Assist in the development, testing and deployment of business process automations for internal customers.

Job Qualifications

Here are a few skills you MUST have to be considered for this position.

  • Currently seeking a degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or related field.
  • Experience in coding in JavaScript, CSS, HTML and jQuery. Knowledge of SPD2013/16/SharePoint Online.
  • Familiarity with Office 365 Platform, PowerApps and Power Automate.
  • Ability to function in a Consumer business office environment and utilize standard office equipment including but not limited to: PC, copier, telephone, etc.
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 25 lbs. (file boxes, computer printer).
  • Travel required sometimes

This is a paid internship, running May 17 – August 6. All candidates must be able to work on site in Raleigh, NC.


About the LGFCU Culture

If you are working here, or considering working here, you should know a little something about the LGFCU culture. We are a workplace that highly values the contributions of a diverse group of people. We believe if we put our heads and hands together, we can accomplish amazing feats for our members. To this end, we recruit bright, energetic and talented people to be members of our team. In return, we offer a dynamic work place that presents opportunities for advancement and learning new skills. We really believe that when our employees succeed, members win.


If you have questions about this position description, please feel welcome to ask. You can reach our HR at:

LGFCU Human Resources

3600 Wake Forest Road

Raleigh, NC 27609

careers@lgfcu.org

Company Overview:

Shamrock Trading Corporation is the parent company for a family of brands in transportation services, finance and technology. Headquartered in Overland Park, KS, Shamrock has been named “Best Places to Work” by the Kansas City Business Journal every year since 2015. We also have offices in Chicago, Dallas, Laredo, Midland and Nashville.

With an average annual revenue growth of 25% since 1986, Shamrock’s success is attributed to three key factors: hiring the best people, cultivating long-term relationships with our customers and continually evolving in the marketplace.

Responsibilities:
Shamrock Trading Corporation is looking for a Helpdesk Intern to join the IT team. This role allows interns to gain experience by receiving formal industry training alongside an established mentor and providing hands-on diagnostic support to employees. The IT Helpdesk Intern will focus on working with the IT team to set up a diverse range of employee software and technology and resolving Help Desk requests. An ideal candidate will be a self-starter with strong analytical and communication skills.

  • Provide first-level support analysis and diagnostics to resolve help desk requests
  • Assist in technology troubleshooting and setup for employee PC hardware, email, phones, printers and copiers, software installations and more
  • Set up and install new workstations and hardware
  • Create new employee accounts and deploy them to end users
  • Work directly with IT staff and end users to diagnose and resolve issues with proprietary applications, third-party software and employee equipment
  • Troubleshoot both hardware and software issues
  • Other duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • Graduation date of December 2021 or May 2022
  • Available to work part-time during the school year
  • GPA of 3.0 and above
  • Pursing a degree in Information Technology, MIS or Business Administration
  • Ability to manage and prioritize work effectively to ensure internal timelines are met
  • Basic desktop troubleshooting knowledge
  • Analytical with strong project management and problem-solving skills
  • Team player with a positive attitude and ability to collaborate effectively with others
  • Ability to lift and relocate end-user computing devices up to 40 lbs.
  • Excellent written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills
  • Ability to adapt in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment
  • Preferred but not required qualifications include:
  • Experience with Microsoft Office suite
  • Working knowledge of Windows 10
Benefits Package:

At Shamrock we hire bright, ambitious people and give them the tools they need to be successful. By investing in training and development, we hope to become a long-term career for employees, where there are always opportunities for advancement. Shamrock also offers a premier set of benefits for employees and their families:

  • Medical: Fully-paid healthcare, dental and vision premiums for employees and eligible dependents
  • Financial: Generous company 401(k) contributions and employee stock ownership after one year
  • Wellness: Onsite gym, jogging trail and discounted membership to nearby fitness center
  • Work-Life Balance: Competitive PTO and paid leave options

Description:

Job purpose

The Data Analytics Intern performs routine business analysis using various techniques, such as statistical analysis, explanatory and predictive modeling, and data mining. Researches best practices and supports developing the solutions and recommendations for the current business operations.

Data Analytics Internship Program Details

The Alliant Health Plans Data Analytics Internship Program provides an opportunity for undergraduates to sharpen their skills and gain experience solving real-life problems using data. Health insurers use data daily to guide decision-making, assess risk, price premiums, and steer strategy. Through the Internship Program, students learn and practice skills in data analytics, predictive modeling, and basic actuarial principles that apply data to real problems facing Alliant Health Plans. Interns will contribute to Alliant’s mission and help improve the health and well-being of the communities we serve. Interns will collaborate with seasoned full-time analysts and have opportunities to meet and learn from senior management. The Alliant Health Plans Data Analytics Internship Program is a paid, ten-week program, allowing as many as twelve interns to participate at a time. The program consists of virtual classroom-based learning for technical skills and insurance concepts, group activities, participation in consulting meetings with stakeholders, teambuilding activities, biweekly book club meetings, and collaboration with peers on deliverables. Interns will present results of their projects to management and bring suggestions for actionable results from their study and work.

Interns will be divided into teams (no more than four on a team) to work on group projects, and also be given smaller, individual projects to complete. Types of projects interns will complete include:

  • Analysis of past claims to look for patterns
  • Creation of models to predict future claims
  • Analysis of authorization data to predict future claims
  • Assisting actuaries in rate filing development
  • Modeling impact of benefit designs on consumer purchasing behavior
  • Modeling of provider contracts
  • Risk Adjustment Analysis
  • Profitability analysis for particular disease states
  • Analysis of clinical pathways
  • Provider network analysis
  • Analysis of impact of regulatory or legislative changes
  • Efficiency analysis of departmental processes or procedures

Skills interns will learn are:

  • SQL/Excel
  • Basic Actuarial Principles
  • Modeling
  • Health Insurance Concepts
  • Health Policy Concepts
  • Financial statement analysis
  • Strategic planning processes and inputs

For purposes of employment, interns are temporary, full-time employees of Health One Alliance and are held to the same standards as all other employees.

. Requirements:

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Works with variety of stakeholders to identify analytical needs
  • Analyzes claims and pharmacy data to identify trends
  • Performs root cause analysis on emerging issues
  • Develops models for evaluating decisions
  • Tests hypotheses using credible statistical methods
  • Provides business data interpretation
  • Produces ad hoc data and reports
  • Assists in developing or implementing systems to capture business operation information
  • Other duties as may be assigned
  • Regular and predictable attendance
  • Consistently demonstrates compliance with HIPAA regulations, professional conduct, and ethical practice

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Accounting, Mathematics, Computer Science, Business, or related field, completed or in process
  • Understanding of statistical methods, with programming experience in R or SAS preferred
  • Basic proficiency with SQL
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
  • Excellent communication skills

Competencies

  • Ethics - Honest, accountable, maintains confidentiality
  • Reliability - The extent to which the employee can be depended upon to be available for work, do it properly, and complete it on time. The degree to which the employee is reliable, trustworthy, and persistent.
  • Sense of Urgency - Meets deadlines, establishes appropriate priority, gets the job done in a timely manner
  • Computer skills - Skilled with computers, takes advantage of new technology, learns new tools quickly, uses technology to enhance job performance
  • Decision making - Able to reach decisions, takes thoughtful approach when considering options, seeks input from others, makes difficult decisions
  • Dependability - Completes job assignment and projects with minimal supervision. Meets schedules and deadlines.
  • Initiative - Takes action, seeks new opportunities, strives to see projects to completion
  • Job knowledge - Knowledge of products, policies and procedures; OR knowledge of techniques, skills, equipment, procedures, and materials.
  • Planning & Organizing - Displays ability to effectively plan, organize and implement applicable tasks or projects in relation to established goals and objectives.
  • Quality - Strives to eliminate errors, accurate work is a priority, seeks opportunities to improve product/services

Physical, Mental, Environmental & Working Conditions

Moderate amount of walking, sitting, and writing. Moderate to significant amount of stress in meeting deadlines and dealing with day-to-day events in the execution of job duties. Needs flexibility and adaptability to change. Candidate must be self-disciplined and a self-starter and able to work independently with a flexible work schedule.
