Job Posting - Mar 2, 2021, 10:46:46 AM

Description

Work Schedule: 20-27 hours per week between 8:00am-5:00pm; on-call as needed

Hiring Range: $14.23 - $15.29 per hour.

NATURE OF WORK
As an IT Intern, within the IT Division, the individual will perform a variety of administrative and technical support duties and to assist the IT Division team.
Individuals in this position provide exceptional, service-focused, and reliable customer service and communication in handling service requests, incidents, and changes. Individuals work under the general supervision of the IT Manager and in collaboration with the IT Division team members.
Individuals in the position are required to perform work in a manner consistent with and exemplary of the Town’s PRIDE philosophies and the Town’s Equal Opportunity Employment policy.

SUPERVISION RECEIVED
Individuals work under the direct supervision of the IT Manager to carry out assigned duties, functions, roles, and projects in both routine and complex circumstances.

Essential Job Functions

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
The Individual in the IT Intern role is assigned specific assignments, job duties, scope, authority, responsibility, roles and requirements as determined by the Town, department, division, and pursuant to laws, regulation and practices. Individuals in this position must be able to successfully perform, be responsible for, and/or assist in the fulfillment of many job functions and duties, with or without reasonable accommodation.
The following duties and responsibilities are illustrative of the primary functions of this position and are not intended to be all inclusive:

  • Assist customers in solving computer-related problems; find alternative solutions if problems cannot be resolved
  • Train customers in the use of computers and software applications
  • Provide analysis, diagnosis, and resolution of end user problems, recommend and implement corrective solutions, and perform necessary changes and/or updates
  • Install, configure, test, maintain, and monitor hardware and software
  • Plan, test, deploy, maintain, and improve various hardware devices, operating systems, software applications, peripherals, and/or communication devices
  • Prioritize and coordinate work with coworkers and with other departments to ensure timely completion of work
  • Collaborate with and help support other IT team members with workload
  • Commit to personal and professional growth of self and support team on growth opportunities
  • Manage service requests, incidents, knowledge base, assets, and configuration items
  • Manage priorities, deadlines, and deliverables of assigned IT projects and changes; communicate project and change status, progress, and issues to IT Manager, IT Team, and other stakeholders
  • Participate in on-call rotation and respond to after-hours system issues
  • Provide input for technology evaluations, budget preparations
  • Assist with vendor relationship management, contract negotiation, and RFP preparation and analysis
  • Build cyber security awareness and knowledge for self, team, and end users
  • Contribute to disaster recovery and business continuity planning process
  • Maintain updated skill sets, in-line with industry best practices
  • Assist in addressing key organizational business/technical issues with IT solutions

OTHER DUTIES
Depending on organizational need, additional duties may include the following:
  • Performs research as directed, such as discovering new technology or tools, market research, etc.
  • Performs related duties as established by law/ordinance or reasonably directed by the Town.
  • Be involved in special projects that are directly or indirectly related to essential job functions.
  • Assists other Town departments/divisions, as necessary.

Education, Knowledge, Skills, Abilities

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

  • Ability to communicate, both orally and in writing, technical ideas to technical and non-technical audiences at multiple levels of the organization
  • Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with other employees, vendors, contractors, and the general public
  • Ability to use independent judgement and discretion in determining & implementing procedures for areas of responsibility
  • Ability to develop and manage the service relationship with customers as well as with outside agencies and vendors.
  • Ability to manage multiple assignments within established deadlines.
  • Knowledge of the theory, principles, trends and/or practices of technology management and cybersecurity, and their application to public sector service delivery.
  • Experience & knowledge in the following areas: network equipment and network terminology; desktop/server environment; server virtualization / cloud application; IT methodology and best practices.
  • Knowledge of hardware and software systems used by the Town (or hardware/systems similar to those used by the Town). Knowledge of the principles, practices, and techniques of hardware configuration, and network operating systems, email systems, LAN/WAN systems, and relational database structures; basic understanding of various programming languages used with current computer technology.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND FORMAL TRAINING
  • High school diploma or GED
  • Bachelor’s degree, recent graduate or currently pursuing one in a related field (information systems, computer science, etc.) preferred
  • Previous IT experience preferred

LICENSES OR CERTIFICATES
  • Must have a current Colorado Driver’s License or the ability to obtain one upon hire, that meets the Town of Windsor’s standards

Additional Information

WORKING ENVIRONMENT & PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

The physical activities of this position include, but are not limited to, the following: climbing, balancing, kneeling, stooping, crawling, reaching, standing, walking, pushing, pulling, lifting, fingering, sitting, grasping, feeling, talking, hearing and repetitive motions.

The physical requirements of this position are considered Light Work: Exerting up to 20 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 10 pounds of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects

The worker is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading; visual inspection involving small defects, small parts, and/or operation of machines (including inspection); using measurement devices; and/or assembly or fabrication of parts at distances close to the eyes.

The employee is subject to inside environmental conditions (protection from weather, but not necessarily temperature changes.) but may be occasionally be exposed to outside conditions in the course of regular activities.

The employee is subject to hazards: Includes a variety of physical conditions, such as proximity to moving mechanical parts, moving vehicles, electrical current, working on scaffolding and high places, exposure to high heat or exposure to chemicals.

The employee frequently is in close quarters, crawl spaces, shafts, man holes, small enclosed rooms, small sewage and water line pipes, and other areas which could cause claustrophobia.

The worker is subject to noise: There is sufficient noise to cause the worker to shout in order to be heard above the ambient noise level.

This position is not considered safety sensitive because the individual does not operate a commercial motor vehicle, as a regular function of his/her daily job duties.

position: 2021 IDB Remote Summer Internship Program | Integration and Trade Sector (INT/TIN)
description:
2021 IDB Remote Summer Internship Program | Integration and Trade Sector INT/TIN


Background of this search:

Between 1990 and 2010, intra-regional trade among Latin American and Caribbean (LAC) countries grew tenfold, approximately from USD 18 billion to USD 180 billion. As of 2011, there are 42 free trade agreements registered which cover 237 bilateral relationships and approximately 89% of the region’s trade volume. This scenario provides outstanding opportunities to deepen the regional integration at the level of SMEs, which account for slightly more than 10% of intraregional trade, and yet have vast importance to the region’s economy (they represent more than 90% of the region’s companies and more than 50% of total employment). In this context, the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB) has made it an institutional priority to strengthen the international investment and commercial ties of SMEs in the region.

In addition, Internet usage in Latin America and the Caribbean grew nearly 891% in the past decade. It was the region that grew the most in the world in internet usage in 2012-2013 (at 12%) far outpacing the second region, Asia-Pacific (7%).


The team’s mission:

Based on the above, in March 2014 the IDB launched ConnectAmericas (CA) (www.connectamericas.com) the first social business network of the Americas. It is a free online platform designed to help small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) carry out more and better international trade and investment transactions. It was launched in March 2014 and currently has over 270,000 businesspeople from over 120 countries registered on the platform, and over 2 million users from 200 countries have accessed its content.

CA allows users to:

  • Publish or apply to purchasing announcements from companies and government entities.
  • Find clients, suppliers, or partners, applying filter (sector, country, verification status) to a database of registered companies.
  • Discover business support services in their countries.
  • Sign up for business events in their countries and the rest of the world.
  • Apply to receive financing from banks in the region.
  • Strengthen their skills through articles, videos, and free online courses.

CA was developed and promoted by the IDB with support from its anchor partners (Google, DHL, Facebook, SeaLand, and Mastercard), and over 300 business support organizations within and beyond LAC. The CA anchor partners are world leaders in aspects that are critical to the development and promotion of the platform.


What you will do:

The objectives of the internship are:

  • To support ConnectAmericas (CA) daily operations and activities. This involves supporting the technology, business development, marketing, events, and data analytics teams.
  • To allow the intern to design, implement, and evaluate its own pilot or “mini-project” for CA. The scope of work will be agreed upon with CA management to ensure alignment with the CA’s objectives for 2021.

The main activities to perform are:

  • Identify and engage new business and knowledge partners for CA and support the implementation of working plans agreed with existing business and knowledge partners, such as Google, DHL, MasterCard, SeaLand, Facebook.
  • Prepare marketing, editorial, and other materials to be disseminated through the CA platform, its social media accounts, email marketing, and other dissemination channels.
  • Support the production of written and audiovisual content in e-commerce, foreign trade, and other topics relevant to the CA audience.
  • Support CA activities such as research, data gathering and processing, and information dissemination (possible topics include trade facilitation, single windows for foreign trade or investment, digital modernization of customs agencies, port communities’ systems, among others).

Deliverables and Payments timeline:

Deliverable 1: Two new Corporate or Knowledge Partner added to CA (includes scope of work definition, and agreed on work plan)

Deliverable 2: Five marketing materials produced (includes dissemination strategy)

Deliverable 3: Ten (10) pieces of content for SMEs produced (can be written, audio, or audiovisual)

Deliverable 4: Three (3) research briefings as a request by CA management

The payment schedule will be as follows: 25% on June 30, 25% on July 15, 25% on July 30, and 25% on August 13, 2021.

What you will need:

  • Education: Active graduate student (Master or PhD. program) or recent graduate from a graduate-level program (maximum of 1 year after graduation date) in a bachelor's degree in international commerce, computer science, data analytics, international relations, marketing, business administration, or similar in an accredited university.
  • Experience: Minimum two years of experience in program management or management support, online marketing, graphic design, MSME support, or applied research.
  • Languages: Be proficient in English and preferably with a working knowledge of one of the Bank’s additional official languages (e.g., Spanish, Portuguese, or French).
  • Soft Skills: Self-management, flexibility, dependability, relationship building, results-driven, with strong communication skills.
  • Technical skills: MS Office, Graphic design.

Remote Internship under PEC modality Requirements:

To be part of our Remote Internship you will need to comply with all the following requirements:

  • Be a national of an IDB member country.
  • Be minimum 23 years of age as of the starting date of the remote summer internship.
  • Be an active graduate student (Master or PhD. program) or recent graduate from a graduate-level program (maximum of 1 year after graduation date) in an accredited University.
  • For active graduate students, submit academic transcripts as an attachment to the application, demonstrating a minimum of 50% of coursework completion and issued within the last 3 months.
  • For recent graduates, submit a valid certificate with a graduation date no older than June 17, 2020, as an attachment to the application.
  • Not be former staff member, Complementary Workforce (“CW”), contractors for the Corporation or the Bank or have previously provided services to the Corporation or the Bank through a contractor or under any other consultant modality.
  • Not have family members (up to the fourth degree of consanguinity and second degree of affinity, including spouse) working at the IDB or IDB Invest.
  • Have access to an Internet connection.

Candidates with more than 3 applications in the 2021 Remote Summer Internship Program for IDB, IDB Lab, and IDB Invest will be automatically disqualified.


Opportunity Summary:

  • Type of contract and modality: Remote Summer Intern hired under Products and External Services Consultant (PEC) modality
  • Length of contract: Two months
  • Internship date: June 16 to August 15, 2021
  • Location: Remote
  • Responsible person: Senior Specialist INT/TIN

Our culture: Our people are committed and passionate about improving lives in Latin-America and the Caribbean, and they get to do what they love in a diverse, collaborative, and stimulating work environment. We are the first Latin American and Caribbean development institution to be awarded the EDGE certification, recognizing our strong commitment to gender equality. As an employee, you can be part of internal resource groups that connect our diverse community around common interests.

We encourage women, afro-descendants, people of indigenous origins, and persons with disabilities to apply.

About us: At the Inter-American Development Bank, we are devoted to improving lives. Since 1959, we have been a leading source of long-term financing for economic, social, and institutional development in Latin America and the Caribbean. We do more than lending though. We partner with our 48 member countries to provide Latin America and the Caribbean with cutting-edge research about relevant development issues, policy advice to inform their decisions, and technical assistance to improve on the planning and execution of projects. For this, we need people who not only have the right skills but also are passionate about improving lives.

Accessibility, Logistics, and Expenses: In case of providing services on your post of hire, or an alternate location, the consultant remote intern will be responsible for setting telephone and computer accesses required to provide the services under this Agreement. The consultant remote intern is fully responsible for any expenses incurred for these purposes, such as but not limited to computer, phone lines, and/or network connections. Also, the intern must be accessible to be contacted and respond within a reasonable time frame (1 day) by means of telephone and/or e-mail for matters related to this contract.

Our team in Human Resources carefully reviews all applications.

position: Tech Support Analyst / Support Engineer Internship
description:
AT NORTHWESTERN MUTUAL, WE ARE STRONG, INNOVATIVE AND GROWING. WE INVEST IN OUR PEOPLE. WE CARE AND MAKE A POSITIVE DIFFERENCE.

Northwestern Mutual has been helping families and businesses achieve financial security for nearly 160 years through a distinctive planning approach that integrates risk management with wealth accumulation, preservation and distribution. With more than $238 billion in assets, $28 billion in revenues and more than $1.6 trillion worth of life insurance protection in force, Northwestern Mutual delivers financial security to more than 4.4 million clients. People are the power behind Northwestern Mutual, and diversity makes us better. We are committed to reflecting and serving the marketplace. We do so by attracting and enhancing the engagement of those who bring their unique perspectives, ideas, and beliefs. At Northwestern Mutual, people matter. And you’ll be working for a company that’s consistently voted among the “most admired” in the nation. We invite you to explore your career interests with us.

This role is to consider applicants for our Technical Support Internship, Support Engineer Internship, and any other internship opportunities at Northwestern Mutual with a similar skillset.

TECHNICAL SUPPORT INTERNSHIP

Our technical support staff serve as the help center for Northwestern Mutual. As an intern, you can expect to:

  • Troubleshoot remote hardware, custom and commercial software, and connectivity issues
  • Conduct support over the phone and with remote access software
  • Learn platforms including Windows 10, Office 365, laptops, desktops, printers, mobile devices and numerous in-house, commercial and mobile applications
  • Complete up to 25 calls per day as the single point of contact for technical issues, requests, and questions for over 10,000 supported staff
  • Opportunity to shadow and network with different Support departments

SUPPORT ENGINEER INTERNSHIP

As a support engineer on the Investment & Product Service's Support team, your job will be to:

  • Maintain and support our applications and ensuring our business can continue selling and servicing our premier products
  • Be a part of a team that manages a portfolio of over 60 applications Other duties include supporting our
  • Complete batch cycles which process critical investment data throughout our environment.
  • Manage incident relationships with mission critical vendors and the associated applications.
  • Leverage agile delivery practices while working with multiple teams across our support and engineering organization.

REQUIRED SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES

  • Undergraduate student actively pursuing a degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field
  • Minimum 3.0 GPA and be in good academic standing
  • Effective oral and written communication skills
  • Demonstrated analytical and problem solving ability
  • High degree of self-motivation and proven ability to meet strict daily deadlines
  • Proven ability to work with a high degree of accuracy
  • Displays a professional attitude
  • Ability to effectively prioritize work and resolve routine problems
  • Basic Microsoft applications experience
  • Hardware or software experience

Job Title:

Legal Student Intern

Department:

Business and Finance | Technology Licensing-JM

Position Description for Legal Intern
Legal Interns play an integral part in the commercialization of technologies. Students in this position will have the opportunity to interact with and learn from seasoned business professionals, outside legal counsel, and licensed attorneys.

Duties include:
  • Assisting in the intellectual property strategy and triage process;
  • Helping commercialization staff determine if and how technology moves forward;
  • Assessing the commercial viability of technologies from Ohio State as startups; and
  • Following the technologies through the startup or licensing process.
Other duties may include but are not limited to: patent research, applications and publications relevant to university inventions; reviewing the commercial potential of university inventions; and other general duties as assigned.

Students in this position are asked to work 9-12 hours per
week during the academic year, with the potential to work up to 32 hours per week during the summer, in relatively large blocks of time.

Qualifications, Skills and Abilities
Desired skills include:
  • Applicant is a 1L, 2L or 3L law student with a strong academic record with an undergraduate
  • degree in a life science, physical science, engineering or computer science;
  • Ability to multi-task in an active environment;
  • Ability to work with minimal direction;
  • Ability to and interest in actively seeking feedback and assignments; and
  • An interest in providing excellent service to the Ohio State community

Additional Information:

About the Corporate engagement Office
The Corporate Engagement Office facilitates best-in-class customer service to connect The Ohio State University’s faculty, students, and staff with external companies and organizations. We work with large companies, startups, entrepreneurs, investors, and community organizations who are actively engaged with university innovators and innovations. There are four areas that we focus on:
  • Technology Commercialization - we advance the university’s research by translating those innovations into business opportunities in the global marketplace.
  • Strategic Partnerships – we work with businesses to connect them with subject-matter experts across the entire university to address their needs across.
  • New Ventures – we help create startup companies based on Ohio State innovations by matching experienced entrepreneurs to a full-continuum of funding and technologies.
  • Economic Development - we collaborate with economic development partners to attract businesses to central Ohio and grow the economy by helping those businesses thrive.
Visit our website at ceo.osu.edu to learn more about what we do.

Micron’s vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for all. Join an inclusive team focused on one thing: using our expertise in the relentless pursuit of innovation for customers and partners. Req. ID: 272081


As a Client SSD Product Marketing Intern in Micron’s Storage Business Unit (SBU), you will engage in projects that directly impact the strategy and marketing for key Solid-State Drive technologies to position Micron for ongoing technology and market success! You will assist in highlighting near-term and long-term trends in the Client and Consumer SSD computing space and evaluate which trends make commercial and economic sense to pursue.


Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Market Analysis of Storage Technology trends

  • Define and recommend new Product Strategies

  • Develop and continue optimization of business cases for SSD product lines

  • Drive a comprehensive analysis of competitor’s products and strategies

  • Develop models, methodologies and criteria for evaluating product and technology concepts and tradeoffs


Qualifications:

  • Ability to grasp complex financial, technical, and market concepts

  • Capable of analyzing and consolidating large data sets from a wide range of sources

  • Draw insights and trends from the analysis

  • Assess and Recommend strategic options and provide direction based on the analytics

  • Communicate those strategic insights effectively to executive management


Education:

  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science and Computer Engineering or a related field

  • Experience with business classes is a plus


About Micron Technology, Inc.

We are an industry leader in innovative memory and storage solutions. Through our global brands – Micron® and Crucial® – our broad portfolio of high-performance memory and storage technologies, including DRAM, NAND, 3D XPoint™ memory and NOR, is transforming how the world uses information to enrich life. Backed by more than 40 years of technology leadership, our memory and storage solutions enable disruptive trends, including artificial intelligence, 5G, machine learning and autonomous vehicles, in key market segments like mobile, data center, client, consumer, industrial, graphics, automotive, and networking. Our common stock is traded on the Nasdaq under the MU symbol. To learn more visit micron.com/careers
